intro: Chrysosplenium ramosum f. viridiflorum, commonly known as the green-flowered chrysosplenium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant belonging to the Saxifragaceae family. It is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
